channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Agency Assist; INC#1608; 09:09PM; 450 E Bauchet St; MAP: https://bit.ly/45NbdtS; #Chinatown; PRELIM: LAFD assisting the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department (LASD) with two suddenly ill persons (unconfirmed age/gender/condition/affiliation) following their exposure to a yet to be identified substance within a Sheriff's jail facility. Both patients are being transported to an area hospital. Because no off-site or escalating hazard has been identified at this time, *All Media Inquiries* Will Be Handled By the LASD Information Bureau.; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 E2 E21 E221 E229 E29 E4 E95 EM1 JT2 JT6 RA17 RA29 RA3 RA4 RA803 RA829 SQ21 SQ95 T21 T29; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#1052; 02:50PM; 2545 W Riverside Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MUuQYs; #SilverLake; PRELIM: School bus (unknown operator / departure or destination) with minor damage after apparently being rear-ended by a compact car. At least two occupants, believed to be (unknown age/gender) "students", are being evaluated by LAFD Paramedics for reportedly minor complaints. No further details. Media Inquiries: CHP Central L.A. (Log #1580) notified and responding per protocol for an incident involving an occupied school bus. ; FS 56; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E220 E250 EM11 RA209 RA55 RA809 RA815 T20 T50; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#0240; 05:26AM; 9224 Sunland Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3qvxUCU; #ShadowHills; PRELIM: Solo vehicle collided into LAFD Fire Station 77. Two civilians with minor injuries decline ambulance transport. The active fire station, occupied by LAFD personnel at the time of the collision, sustained only superficial damage. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #646); FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 E289 RA77 T89 UR88; CH8; 18; Brian Humphrey

Hiker Rescue; INC#1058; 03:45PM; Wilson Canyon Loop Trail; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MTbBOG; #Sylmar; LAFD ground and air response to a 26 year-old female hiker who sustained an ankle injury in a ground level fall on a remote section of the Wilson Canyon Loop Trail in the San Gabriel Mountain foothills. An LAFD Flight Paramedic has been lowered from a hovering LAFD rescue helicopter to medically assess and stabilize the patient, who will soon be hoisted onto the aircraft with the LAFD Flight Paramedic, for in-flight care during direct transport to an area hospital. No further details.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E275 E91 H0D H3 H7 HA3 HA7 RA898 RA91 RH214 T75; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Brush Fire; INC#1050; 04:08PM; 1428 W Cliff Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MQQgWh; #MountWashington; With aerial reconnaissance and command support from an LAFD helicopter, the first arriving 42 LAFD ground personnel held the fire to less than one-half acre of light grass, extinguishing flames in just 28 minutes. No injury. No structure damage. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 44; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 CM20 CM22 E12 E212 E250 E3 E4 E44 E55 E56 EM1 H7 HA7 RA1 T12 T50; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1050; 03:40PM; 1428 W Cliff Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MQQgWh; #MountWashington; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to less than one-half acre of light grass burning mid-slope. No structure threat.; FS 44; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 CM20 CM22 E12 E212 E250 E3 E4 E44 E55 E56 EM1 H7 HA7 RA1 T12 T50; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Hiker Rescue; INC#0893; 02:18PM; Haines Canyon Motorway; MAP: https://bit.ly/42qk4ih; #Tujunga; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to an 47 year-old male mountain bicyclist who sustained a severe ankle fracture in a fall from a remote section of the Haines Canyon Motorway in the San Gabriel Mountain foothills. A pair of LAFD Flight Paramedics have been lowered from a hovering LAFD rescue helicopter to medically assess and stabilize the patient, who will soon be hoisted onto the aircraft with the LAFD Flight Paramedics, for in-flight treatment during direct transport to an area hospital. No further details.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E24 E274 H3 H7 HA3 HA7 RA74 RH114 T74; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Brush Fire; INC#0794; 01:33PM; 4430 N San Rafael Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45MaRDF; #MountWashington; With aerial reconnaissance and command support from an LAFD helicopter, the first arriving 36 LAFD ground personnel quickly held the fire to less than one-half acre light-to-medium grass and brush, extinguishing the flames in just 22 minutes. No injury. No structure threat or damage. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 55; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AO1 AO2 BC2 BC5 E201 E212 E250 E290 E42 E44 E47 E55 E56 EM1 H2 H3 H7 HA2 HA3 HA7 T1 T12 T50 T90; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#0794; 01:11PM; 4430 N San Rafael Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45MaRDF; #MountWashington; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to one-half acre medium-to-heavy brush burning uphill. No structure threat.; FS 55; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AO1 AO2 BC2 BC5 E201 E212 E250 E290 E42 E44 E47 E55 E56 EM1 H2 H3 H7 HA2 HA3 HA7 T1 T12 T50 T90; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1543; 10:45PM; 208 N Dillon St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3C7gvTz; Westlake; KNOCKDOWN: 38 firefighters extinguished the fire in 20 mins with no injuries reported. The occupants of the exposed apartment building were safely evacuated. Cause TBD. No further details.; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 CM20 CM22 E20 E211 E235 E35 E6 EM11 RA11 RA6 RA806 T11 T35; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart
